title: UchihaSarada
author: UchihaSarada
content: This song: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zEQ2nPSL5-0If after listening to the song and love it, you can explore a description about the song, its history and its lyricsI don't know how do you feel but I do love it and listen to it every day.QuoteEnjoy this famous song by Nashville singer-songwriter and host of the Bitcoins & Gravy podcast, John Barrett. This song is played in every episode of the show. If you like it, please feel free to share it far and wide, and tune in to the Bitcoins & Gravy show for interesting information and interviews related to all things crypto...LyricsOde To SatoshiWell Satoshi Nakamoto that's a name I love to sayAnd we don't know much about him, but he came to save the dayWhen he wrote about the way things areand the way things ought to beHe gave us all a protocol this world had never seenOh Bitcoin as you're going into the old BlockchainOh Bitcoin I know you're going to reign, gonna reignTill everybody knows, everybody knows,till everybody knows your nameDown the road it will be told about the Death of Old MtGoxAbout traitors trading alter coins and minors mining blocksBut them good old boys back in Illinoisand on down through TennesseeSee they don't care to be a millionaire,they're just wanting to be freeOh Bitcoin as you're going into the old BlockchainOh Bitcoin I know you're going to reign, gonna reignTill everybody knows, everybody knows,till everybody knows your nameFrom the ghettos of Calcutta to the halls of ParliamentWhile the bankers count Our money out for every governmentOld Bitcoin flies on through the skies of VirtualityA promise to deliver us from age old TyrannyOh Bitcoin as you're going into the old BlockchainOh Bitcoin I know you're going to reign, gonna reignTill everybody knows, everybody knows,till everybody knows your nameTill everybody knows, everybody knows,till everybody knows your"Give me some Exposure"Everybody knows your nameSinging:Oh Lord pass me some moreOh Lord before I have to goOh Lord pass me some moreOh Lord . . . before I have to . . .go . . ."Thanks East Nashville! Y'all be good to each other out there ya hear!"Sheet music in "G"Sheet music in "A"
